div.p: 4th - 5th & 13 OCT 2024
Rugby, United Kingdom

div.h3: The eagerly awaited time of the year is here once again!
div.p: We are thrilled to welcome you back for the fourth consecutive year of Navli Navratri Nights!.
Over the past three years, your continues support and love have made this festival truly special, and we can't wait to create more wonderful memories with you.

As Navratri approaches, we extend a heartfelt invitation to join us in celebrating, honoring, and worshiping the Divine Goddess through the vibrant rhythms of Garba and Dandiya. Let's come together to offer our devotion to Maa Ambe and make this Navratri unforgettable!
Sports Centre Rugby College, Technology Drive, Rugby, CV21 1AR
Friday and Saturday
4th & 5th October 2024
GARBA 6:30 PM - 11:30 PM
Rugby Indian Association, Edward Street, Rugby, CV21 2EZ
Sunday
13th OCTOBER 2024
with Fafda Jalebi (Included)
GARBA 5:00 PM - 9:00 PM
Please note that this event is organised on a non-profit basis, with all funds collected directed towards the Saarthi Foundation.

The Saarthi Foundation is dedicated to alleviating poverty in specific regions of India. Our mission extends to assisting underprivileged individuals in dire financial circumstances, providing them with crucial support for medical, educational, and living expenses, among other necessities.

Furthermore, a portion of the funds raised will be donated to the Guria Charitable Foundation in India. These funds will be directed towards meeting the needs of children supported by this admirable charity.

Guria is a non-profit organization founded by Mr. Ajeet Singh and Mrs. Manju Singh. Their organisation is committed to combating child prostitution, second-generation prostitution, and sex trafficking in Northern India and advocating for freedom on a global scale.
For additional details about Guria and its impactful work, please visit Guria Charitable Foundation
If you are interested in making an additional donation or require further information, please feel free to reach out to Pallavi Joshi.
Your generous support will go a long way in making a meaningful difference in the lives of those in need.

div.h3: Recorded garba will be played from 06:30 PM to 11:30 PM.

div.p: ( Advance Booking Only For 4th - 5th and 13th October 2024 )
**Enjoy live catering with South Indian dishes like idli, dosa, and medu vada, available for purchase at the venue!
Event venue location info and gallery
Technology Drive, Rugby, CV21 1AR
**Free Parking Available**
Edward St, Rugby CV21 2EZ
**Free Parking Available**
Guria Charitable foundation
Our final thought...

This Navratri, let's come together to celebrate the joyous rhythms of Garba in the presence of Maa Ambe. As we unite in merriment, we also take a meaningful step closer to supporting children and families, working towards a brighter future in India.
We eagerly anticipate your presence at Navli Navratri Nights, where we can create lasting memories and contribute to important causes.

div.p:
During the Navratri event, our team will be capturing photos and videos to document the celebration and create memorable moments. If you have any objections or concerns regarding being photographed or filmed, or if you wish to avoid being included in our event materials, please inform us in advance. We highly value your comfort and will make every effort to accommodate your preferences, ensuring a pleasant and enjoyable experience for all attendees.
Your privacy and comfort are important to us, and we appreciate your cooperation in helping us make the event a positive and inclusive experience for everyone.

Please note this is a non-profitable event, all the funds collected will be donated to Guria charitable foundation in India. Funds collected will be used to meet the needs of children supported by the charity. Guria is a non-profitable organisation found by Mr Ajeet Singh and Mrs Manju Singh. The organisation is dedicated to fighting against child prostitution, second generation prostitution and sex trafficking in Northern India, and to achieve freedom worldwide. Further information can be found on, www.guriaindia.org.
